headline: From Apple to GM, Tariffs to Cost Companies Tens of Billions

headline: Oracle Health Information Network Achieves Candidate Status for TEFCA QHIN
summary: Oracle Health Information Network Inc., a subsidiary of Oracle Health, is now a candidate Qualified Health Information Network® (QHIN™) as a part of the Trusted Exchange Framework and Common Agreement™ (TEFCA™). With this achievement, it will now begin the pre-production testing and project plan completion phase of the onboarding and designation process.

raw.headline: Oracle Health Information Network Achieves Candidate Status for TEFCA QHIN

headline: Oracle Named #1 in Home Energy Management Systems by Guidehouse Research
summary: As power demand and energy costs continue to rise, home energy management (HEM) technologies are growing increasingly critical to keeping electricity affordable and the grid stable in crucial moments. Citing Oracle's superior strategic execution, advanced solutions, and ability to serve utilities globally at scale, Guidehouse Research named Oracle Utilities the top provider in its 2025 Home Energy Management Systems report.1

headline: Trump to Rescind Global Chip Curbs, Prep New AI Restrictions
